heading: 1. These Regulations may be cited as the Road Traffic (Courses of
text_raw:
1. These Regulations may be cited as the Road Traffic (Courses of 
Instruction) (Motorcycles) (Extension of Period of Validity of Certificate) 
Regulations 2021.
text_norm: 1 regulation may cited road traffic (courses instruction) (motorcycles) (extension period validity certificate) regulation 2021

title: (Alteration of Name of Department and Title of Minister) Order 2020 (S.I. No.
heading: In these Regulations -
text_raw:
2. 

In these Regulations - 

“Regulations of 2011” means the Road Traffic (Courses of Instruction) 
(Motorcycles) Regulations 2011 (S.I. No. 681 of 2011); 

“IBT certificate” has the same meaning as it has in the Regulations of 2011.
text_norm: 2 regulation - regulation 2011 mean road traffic (courses instruction) (motorcycles) regulation 2011 (s.i no 681 2011) ibt certificate meaning regulation 2011

title: (Alteration of Name of Department and Title of Minister) Order 2020 (S.I. No.
heading: 3. Notwithstanding Regulation 9 of, and Schedule 2 (inserted by Regulation
text_raw:
3. Notwithstanding Regulation 9 of, and Schedule 2 (inserted by Regulation 
2(i) of the Road Traffic (Courses of Instruction) (Motorcycles) (Amendment) 
Regulations 2018 (S.I. No. 433 of 2018)) to, the Regulations of 2011 and the 
Road Traffic (Courses of Instruction) (Motorcycles) (Extension of Period of 
Validity of Certificate) Regulations 2020 (S.I. No. 123 of 2020) - 

(a) 

(b) 

(c) 

an IBT certificate issued during the period beginning on 01 March 
2018 and ending on 30 June 2018 is valid until 01 October 2021, 

an IBT certificate issued during the period beginning on 01 July 
2018 and ending on 31 August 2018 is valid for a period of 3 
years and 2 months from the date of issue, 

an IBT certificate issued during the period beginning on 01 
September 2018 and ending on 30 June 2019 is valid for a period 
of 3 years from the date of issue. 

Notice of the making of this Statutory Instrument was published in 
“Iris Oifigiúil” of 20th July, 2021. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 [357] 3 

GIVEN under my hand, 
 13 July 2021 

HILDEGARDE NAUGHTON, 
 Minister of State at the Department of Transport. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 4 [357]

title: (Alteration of Name of Department and Title of Minister) Order 2020 (S.I. No.
heading: (This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal
text_raw:
EXPLANATORY NOTE 

(This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal 
interpretation.) 

These Regulations amend 
the Road Traffic (Courses of Instruction) 
(Motorcycles) Regulations 2011 (S.I. No. 681 of 2011) to provide that a 
certificate of satisfactory completion of initial basic training for motorcyclists, 
an IBT certificate, issued during the period beginning on 1 March 2018 and 
ending on 30 June 2018 is valid until 01 October 2021, an IBT certificate issued 
during the period beginning on 01 July 2018 and ending on 31 August 2018 is 
valid for a period of 3 years and 2 months from the date of issue, an IBT 
certificate issued during the period beginning on 01 September 2018 and ending 
on 30 June 2019 is valid for a period of 3 years from the date of issue. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 [357] 5 

BAILE ÁTHA CLIATH 
ARNA FHOILSIÚ AG OIFIG AN tSOLÁTHAIR
